(UNUSUAL PERSON)

maverick noun [C]
(YOUNG COW)
US a calf (= young cow) that has not been branded (= had its owner's mark burned onto it): Mavericks are wild cattle that haven't been branded and have never been gathered. Cowboys believed they had as much of a right to the mavericks they found on the range as did the ranchers.
